x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Underserved communities face significant barriers in accessing quality skill development programs. Traditional training programs often fail to:
- Identify individual learning styles and pace requirements - Match learners with appropriate mentors and resources - Track progress and provide personalized feedback - Connect learners with real-world opportunities post-training
This creates a cycle where those who need upskilling the most have the least access to effective, personalized learning pathways.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: SkillSync - AI-Powered Skill Gap Bridge for Underserved Communities
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Now Assist for CSM - AI-powered skill assessment and personalized learning path recommendations
  • App Engine Studio - Custom tables for learners, mentors, skills, courses, and opportunities
  • Flow Designer - Automated matching algorithms, progress tracking, and milestone notifications
  • Virtual Agent - 24/7 learning support and guidance
  • Performance Analytics - Track learning outcomes, mentor effectiveness, and program impact
  • Integration Hub - Connect with LinkedIn Learning, Coursera, Khan Academy, and job boards
  • Mobile App Builder - Accessible learning on any device

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with learning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Coursera, Udemy)
  • Job board APIs (Indeed, LinkedIn Jobs)
  • Video conferencing for mentor sessions (Zoom/Teams)
  • Optional: AI/ML models for advanced skill gap analysis

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Recruiting and retaining quality mentors
  • Ensuring consistent internet access for learners
  • Language barriers and content localization
  • Measuring long-term impact beyond platform metrics
  • Building trust in underserved communities
